discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. It relies upon other layers for packet delivery.

The application layer is the topmost layer in the OSI model, and it provides services and protocols that directly interact with end-user applications. However, it relies on the transport layer (and lower layers) to ensure packet delivery, as it doesn't handle the actual transmission of data.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a characteristic of the application layer?

choices.A: It relies upon other layers for packet delivery.
choices.B: It checks independently for packet loss.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) is a protocol that encrypts and authenticates data packets between devices in a virtual private network (VPN) or other IPsec-based networks

questions.question_text: Which of the following IP transmission types encrypts all of the transmitted data?
Which of the following should be configured so users can authenticate to a wireless network using company credentials?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) is a networking protocol that authenticates and authorizes users who access a network

questions.question_text: A network engineer performed a migration to a new mail server. The engineer changed the MX record, verified the change was accurate, and confirmed the new mail server was reachable via the IP address in the A record. However, users are not receiving email. Which of the following should the engineer have done to prevent the issue from occurring?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Reduce the TTL record prior to the MX record change.

TTL (Time to Live) determines how long DNS records are cached by resolvers and other DNS servers. By reducing the TTL value prior to making the MX record change, the network engineer would have ensured that the new MX record would be propagated faster, reducing the time it takes for DNS servers and mail clients to recognize the change.

choices.C: Perform a DNS zone transfer prior to the MX record change.
choices.A: Change the email client configuration to match the MX record.
choices.D: Update the NS record to reflect the IP address change.
choices.B: Reduce the TTL record prior to the MX record change.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Network segmentation involves dividing a network into smaller, isolated subnetworks. This allows administrators to control access to sensitive OT devices. By isolating OT devices from the general corporate network, attackers attempting to compromise the OT system are prevented from spreading to other parts of the network. This is crucial for protecting industrial control systems and other critical infrastructure

Selected Answer: D
D. Network segmentation

When adding Operational Technology (OT) devices to an organization's architecture, network segmentation is essential. OT devices often have specific security and operational requirements that differ from traditional IT devices. Segmenting OT networks from IT networks helps to protect critical OT systems from cyber threats, limit the spread of attacks, and ensure that the OT environment remains secure and isolated from the broader corporate network.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should a network administrator configure when adding OT devices to an organization's architecture?
